subject: Re: [junit] assertArrayEquals on arrays of objects
msgSnippet: Please stop emailing me. From: Robert Wenner  To: junit@yahoogroups.com Sent: Saturday, November 17, 2012 4:30 PM Subject: Re: [junit]
messageBody:
Please stop emailing me.


From: Robert Wenner <robert.wenner@...>
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, November 17, 2012 4:30 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] assertArrayEquals on arrays of objects

Â 
On Sat, 17 Nov 2012 19:57:24 +0000 Colin Vipurs <mailto:zodiaczx6%40gmail.com>
wrote:

> You'll need to override equals (and by definition hashCode) on the
> objects in your array. I generally advise against doing this purely
> for tests

Isn't that a sign that production code may want to do this as well and
that equality for these objects may make sense?

> and instead look at implementing your own hamcrest matcher.

How would a matcher check for equality without calling equals or
hashCode?

Robert
